website_summaries.verdict: This uniquely shaped vacuum is ideal for sucking debris out of corners and tight spaces.
pros: V-shaped design drives debris in front of the vacuum for easier clean-up
Swivel head makes it easy to maneuver around furniture
Great for picking up debris in tight spots with no attachments needed
cons: Users say this vacuum is prone to clogging and requires routine maintenance

website_summaries.verdict: A sound option if you need a lightweight model for hardwood floors and low-pile carpet; but it's not recommended for heavy-duty cleaning or thick carpet.
pros: Offers a unique swivel-action V-shaped head for hard-to-reach corners and crevices
Dirt canister is easy to empty and put back into place
cons: The cord is only 20 feet long, and it's not recommended for high-pile carpet

customer_reviews.title: Works and works and works
customer_reviews.text: Every time I use this vacuum I think, "I need to write a review." I'm finally writing one. I've owned this vacuum for almost 4 years and I don't know what I would do without it. I despise pet hair on my floors (yes, I know, I probably shouldn't have pets, but I do), and I am compulsive about trying to get rid of it. I have a house with only tile and hardwood. This machine is a workhorse and very satisfying to use. It has never failed to perform. Additionally, I have never replaced the filters, i just clean them out by rising them in the sink, let them dry, and use them again. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zen

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw!!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great until it got clogged. This has a MAJOR DESIGN FLAW!! Very frustrating. The hole that leads the dirt into the tank is almost IMPOSSIBLE to access so if it gets clogged there is no way to unclog it. I tried taking the damn thing apart even, removing screws that didn’t do anything?? No matter what I tried I could not access it and now my vacuum that is only a few months old is useless. This would be great if it weren’t for this one major flaw. You’d think the person who designed this would have better sense.
customer_reviews.author: bluebunneh

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed dark hardwood floors in my home and I have three large furry dogs. The hair and dirt are a constant. This product was easy to assemble and works amazing on my floors. Surprisingly enough, it even worked on getting dog hair off the sofa! This will also work on very low pile carpet or area rugs. I love how it gets into the corners and works along the baseboards. The V shape makes it much easier to maneuver around furniture legs as well. I would totally recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: c yates

customer_reviews.title: Useless until you remove the foam filter insert!!!!! Read this if you've had problems with suction.
customer_reviews.text: Useless without removing the foam filter insert. I put this together and was disappointed that there was no suction at all. Took it apart, got rid of the foam covering around the filter (see pictures), put it back together, and SUCTION!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Pet Hair on Cortec LVT Floors!!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased our Forever Home at the Beach in Surf City, NC. We have a Jack Russell that sheds constantly!! I bought this vacuum for our new floors, that you can’t use a beater bar vac on. It works phenomenal!! No damage to floor and No more Dog Hair or Sand!!! Good Quality, Very Powerful, and worth every penny!! Do yourself a favor and buy it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Margie White

customer_reviews.title: This seemed like such a good idea as back up to my ...
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like such a good idea as back up to my roomba. Nope. You have to repeatedly kick the head of the vacuum down if you bring it anywhere close to upright. It is awkward to maneuver, and does not turn easily on hardwood or tile. You basically end up picking it up and putting it down a lot. It also does a very poor job of picking anything up that is not in the center of the V, so getting along the baseboards won't happen. An expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoJen

customer_reviews.title: Not good for anything except corners
customer_reviews.text: Not good for anything except corners. not worth time or effort. trying to return but the top handle will not come out!! Trying to figure out how to return in different box?????? NOW i am beyond the return time :(
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Gaw

customer_reviews.title: Like all Bissell products I've had
customer_reviews.text: Like all Bissell products I've had, 1 year tops and it craps out. And this one is not user friendly to take apart to unclog, nor do I like having to sit on the floor (that clearly is covered in dust from taking the vaccuum apart) when a nice foot control would have been a lot easier. And even if I do get it unclogged (with pet hair might I had...2 cats) there is still no suction and does not pick up kitty litter. I hate to use because it has its own ergonomic flaws but at least my Eureka hose vac picks up EVERYTHING and never clogs.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherRose

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a few months. It still runs but it isn’t picking up much now. There is a space between the top of the canister. It is now allowing hair and dust to bypass the canister and clog the the filter with hair and dust. I have now bought replacement that hopefully will hold up. After nine months it isn’t worth my time to fight with the manufacturer to get it fixed or replaced. I have four dogs and two cats. I vacuum the entire house every other day. It just didn’t hold up to my wood floors. The wheels are wobbly and the edge part is actually at the wrong angle to suck up dirt and hair.
customer_reviews.author: David L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!! BUY IT NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 different full size vacuums and they couldnt do what this handy lightweight easy to maneuver electric broom does. Sucks up my cats litter and hair off wood floors with ZERO issues. I cant recommend this more. For quick "sweeping" jobs its so handy. broom and dust pan are gone! I keep it plugged in, in a central part of my living room and im able to "sweep" the whole thing in a matter of seconds. The bagless tank hold soooo much. only have to empty it like every 10 "sweeps" The v shaped front helps siphon everything to the center suction.I LOVE THIS THING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L.

customer_reviews.title: V-nozzle is great for corraling pet hair. Only lasted 8 years.
customer_reviews.text: V-nozzle is also good for outside and inside corners. Great with pet hair. Easy to maneuver around furniture legs too. Bend at the top of the airway clogs easily. A right angle needle nose pliers makes it easier to clear the clog. Twigs, the stray toothpick, leaf fragments don't make the bend and then capture hair. lint, etc. That is my main complaint, but it does the other things well enough that I just ordered another one. Appliances should last longer than 8 years. But I don't see many that do any more. Plastic getting brittle and starting to break.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas O.

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: This machine could use a lot of work. The shape of it, while it seems like an innovative idea makes it unwieldy and causes it to miss dirt. The suction is just barely enough. The cord is nice and long which I do like but the biggest problem with the machine is that the pet hair gets tangled around the upper compartment rather than dropping to the catch bowl below. This means you have to remove this section and use your hands to pull the hair off. Yuck. I added a photo
customer_reviews.author: Kathy PerryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: Hate this thing. It’s worthless on the floor unless your entire room is full of furniture or you have nothing but corners. It sucks up nothing on the rest of the floor. I ended up putting it in the basement storage room where it sits all alone. One of these days i’ll get around to going down and getting it and just throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Rummy3

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a lightweight vaccum for my hard wood and rugs. I've used it maybe a handful of times since it was delivered on March 17. This vaccum was useless on my rugs, to which I thought maybe itll just be a hardwood vacuum and I can use another one for the rugs.....nope. this vacuum wouldnt even pick up visible dirt on the floor. DO NOT BUY, the second vacuum I got for $30 is better than this one and half the price!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 45 days, then loses all suction power
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum for the first 45 days. Then today went to vacuum after emptying the canister, and it wouldn't suck up anything!! Emptied the top and bottom filter, and still, nothing. The vacuum is on, but it has zero suction at the bottom...there is nothing else to empty or unplug. I should have listened to the other reviews that mentioned this, I thought I would be luck and get a *good* one. Now I am out of the product return window, and have to deal with Bissell.
customer_reviews.author: laffytaffy

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this gem!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hardwood floor vacuum. I don't usually write reviews but I am so glad I bought this product I had to let others know. We have two cats and lots of shedding which created "tumbleweeds" everywhere. No matter how much I swept the floor I couldn't pick it all up. Now that I have this lightweight, handy-dandy, vac I actually enjoy vacuuming the floors look great! I can't even believe I like to vacuum! Great product for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: jjm

customer_reviews.title: This machine wasn't for me - Hard to push!
customer_reviews.text: I got the pet version and it has this hard plastic strip on the bottom, where it sucks. Made it very difficult to push, and i have hardwood flooring. I also was not pleased with the placement of the filter. When I would take out the dust pan to empty, dust and dirt would fall onto the filter area. just annoying. I was using a hoover before and really didn't want the new cordless one. Dealing with another battery to charge sounded like a pain, but no...this machine was the pain. I returned this Bissell. Got the cordless hoover and I'm SO happy with it. I'm thankful for the free returns!! Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Granola

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well it works.
customer_reviews.text: The Vacuum picks up everything. Outstanding suction. Lightweight. The “claw” bottom takes a little get used to but actually worked great around table legs and picked up dirt against trim of the walls. My only grips are longer cord would be better. They give you 20ft but I still found myself adding an extension cord and my house is not huge. Limited to run it under side tables and tv cabinets as it barely fits because it stops at the funnel part. I had swept up dirt and dog hair the night before with a broom and this apparently picked up all the hair and dirt I had missed!. For $70.00 this got the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Great power, and small enough to tuck away in a closet without taking up too much room
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect buy. I was wanting to buy a robot vacuum like a roomba but didn’t want to spend all that money to keep my hardwood clean. So I started looking for something that could sweep but a little more efficient and faster than a regular broom and this was it. It picked up so much cat hair and litter that I honestly didn’t even know was in the floor. It’s very easy to clean and the cords length is perfect for small apartments.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton s

customer_reviews.title: great for picking up cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Alright, so I love this vacuum! It picks up the cat litter off my hardwood floors instead of throwing it like my other vacuum. The suction can be improved by removing the foam filter around the actual filter -- easy improvement. The only reason I gave this product 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because it doesn't have a detachable hose for hard to reach areas. The shape was weird at first, but now that I've used it, I really like the fact that it is angled. Rolls smooth and isn't very loud compared to other vacuums I've tried. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C Hennings

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Vac works great on hard wood floors and tile. The V shape is a little odd. It hugs corners well but going across a flat area, like against the wall or baseboards is ok. Under the head of the vaccuum is a rubber squeegee kind of thing that channels first towards the center column, which is where the suction is. So when going along a wall, the squeegee pushes dirt that get sucked in. It does miss things but we use at least one a week to pick up dust and dog hair. Cleaning out the canister is super easy. Got one for my elderly parents too and they love it. Super light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DogLover

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily but works great.
customer_reviews.text: Super delicate with an archiles heel. Great for tiled floors. I liked it so much that I bought it again after my first one broke at the base. However after 3 gentle years of use, the second one also broke at the same spot. See pictures. Oops, amazon is fearful of my product pictures so theres no option anymore to upload pics.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Gizmo Freak

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful one trick pony
customer_reviews.text: This vaccuum is really great, but it seriously only does one thing. If you have even a single rug in your house, this vacuum is not for you. If you like to vacuum cobwebs or under the bed, it is not for you because there isn't a hose. If it had a hose it would be pretty close to perfect. Super strong suction. My one complaint is that the motor emits so much air that if you are in a corner or close space it will actually blow the hair away before it can be vacuumed up. This can be pretty frustrating. Without this problem it would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Bean

customer_reviews.title: Husky Hair
customer_reviews.text: I have a 65lb husky who sheds a sweater's worth of hair every single day and that hair gets into every freaking nook and cranny you can possibly imagine. I do have to empty the canister often, but other than that, this vacuum has been working great so far. The one real con is that I just don't understand the weird V shaped head. It goes around corners and that's cool but it's hard to get into some places. I kind of wish it was just a straight head. It's just a mild frustration though, and I'm still happy with this vacuum overall.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wishowski

customer_reviews.title: About what's expected at the weight and price point
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to hit corners with at timeadue to the way it's set up, and it has significant outflow right on top of the head. Basically don't try and sweep the things you can't get into its grasp because the outflow will blow it everywhere. As far as hair, it clogs fairly quick, but it keeps sucking. It's amazing for shorthair dogs and hardwood floor quick clean ups, just not a "sweep the whole house" type of vacuum". Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bayer

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 indoor dogs who shed like crazy. I've been looking for something to replace my sweeping routine which I felt was leaving just as much for as I picked up. This is lightweight and easy to use. It's super effective on the floating dog hair and pulls it right to it. I'm never using a broom again. Also to note, this doesnt replace weekly vacuuming (with my Shark vacuum) but does keep my house presentable in between quickly and easily. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good with hair but not great at all
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this unit for over a year. Using it on a hardwood floor with 1 dog in the house. It picks up hair pretty good but i have to go over the floor a couple times. It would really be easier if i just used a broom & dust pan. So this unit is ok but dont expect it to pick anything else up off the hardwood floor. it does a little dirt but like I said, there is much to be desired in increasing the suction capabilities of this vacuum. I primarily use this ownly for pet hair. it would be nice if it would perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Studio Apartment!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well on the hardwood of my studio apartment. It gets every little bit of dirt, lint, and hair that my dog likes to leave around, BUT it absolutely cannot go on any rugs or carpets. I have a small carpet at the center of my apartment on which I keep my work desk and while it can somewhat pick up whatever is in the carpet, the suction and lack of rotary components in the funnel cause it to stick hard to the carpet and prevent movement. That said, it is a vacuum designed for pet hair and hard floors and it excels at that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepsteaks

customer_reviews.title: More frustration than it's worth
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum sucks... and not in the way it was intended. I have several Bissell products and all of them work very well, with the exception of this one. The V shape design prevents you from getting close to flat walls and into tight spaces. The only place it really works well is on outside corners. It also refuses to roll in the direction you push it. It's like pushing a cart with a bad wheel. It also clogs very easily, which is contradictory to it being the "pet vacuum". This will definitely be featured in my next garage sale!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum changed my life! It cuts my cleaning time in half and get all of the fur! I gave it a 4 on versatility because it doesn't pick up slightly larger bits of plastic, but that isn't a big deal. I'm clumsy and have dropped it several times and it still works great! If you have pets or hard surface floors this is great! Couldn't tell you how it works on carpet though.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good for parrot owners
customer_reviews.text: First impression: Good product for small parrot owners. Vaccuums up seed, pellets, feather fluff. Because of its shape it's hard figure out how to vaccuum a straight wall, but once you figure it out its easy. Very much like this product made it very easy and quick to vaccuum living room kitchen and bird room. We have 8 green cheek conures and they make quite a mess. Time will tell if this vaccuum will hold up. It feels cheappy made but its suction is very good. We also have a visual vaccuum for carpet and love it. Will update after future uses. So far we liked.
customer_reviews.author: Jesslynn Ewan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this vacuum for about 6 months now, so a I feel like I can leave an accurate review at this point. I’ve got black hardwood floors and a white American short hair that sheds like nobody’s business! This vacuum has been a LIFESAVER! It works better to pick up her hair on old hardwood than the Dyson V8 Animal vacuum that was gifted to me does by far. I love how it pivots and is V-shaped. It gets directly up against the baseboards and into the corners with ease, which I definitely couldn’t say about the Dyson. If you have hardwood floors (or tile) and a pet that sheds, this vacuum is well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great While It Worked
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hardwood floor vacuum while it works.. We have a dog who sheds a lot and this lightweight-easy-to-maneuver vacuum had no problems keeping the floors dust,grit, and fur free... HOWEVER, this vacuums suction power went from powerful to nonexistent in the FOUR months I've owned it. I have tried various troubleshooting methods, such as, emptying out contents after each use, cleaning out filter, & disassembling head to see if there is a build up, all to no avail. Really disappointed that this vacuum was not built for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: hard to push
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is great but it hurts my wrist to push this vacuum. I am going to have to return it and look for another one that has better wheels on the front to aid in pushing. The wheels on this vacuum are very tiny on the front. I called the manufacturer to get instructions on how to get the handle out of the body for packing. They were wonderful and I would not hesitate to buy another one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: happy in Columbia

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I can't live without it, honestly. It is great at getting up dog hair, has excellent pick up power just be sure to clean the filter on the regular. I am a little rough with it and knock it over a lot so that has something to do with it but I have bought three of them because they seem to break easily where it connects to the bottom piece. Great on hard wood floors and the rugs at the doors.
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: really really good for hardwood floor
customer_reviews.text: So I used to use Dyson vacuum (yes, the 300 dollars one) when I live in a house full of carpet. but since I move to a hardwood floor place, I realize the Dyson did not work that well. So i switched to this product. GOD! it really suck the cat/human hairs from few inches away. It also sucks up the remaining cat litter very well... But do remember, this vacuum is good for hardwood, not carpet. It actually did not work on the carpet at all.
customer_reviews.author: Will Cao

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! So light weight and convenient with great suction power. Picks up ALL the hair and easy to empty and clean. Not intended for rugs or carpet in my opinion. It just doesn’t work well on those surfaces, but I don’t believe it is intended for carpet so that didn’t affect my rating. The corner design is nice but makes it a bit difficult to get close up to straight edges. I wouldn’t be mad if it had a longer cord too. Overall I’d recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Jami R.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done. Easy to use, lightweight, maneuverable.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a good purchase for me. It’s lightweight and easy to maneuver. The suction power is outstanding. It vacuums my hardwood floors very thoroughly. It’s easy to empty after use and easy to store. The only drawback is the awkward push button to release the handle from its upright position. I really like this product and already recommended it to a friend who also bought it. You will enjoy this product if you decide to purchase it because put quite simply: it gets the job done...it works.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: It scratches wood floors
customer_reviews.text: Is on a good job of picking up the pet hairs it is not good when you're just trying to clean your floors because it doesn't work on straight edge At all but it's OK I'm corners I am not having to get down on my hands and knees and take all of the dusts in any try anything else that doesn't pick up and put it together and then vacuum it up but I most unhappy about All the scratching on my wood floors. It leaves scuff marks behind and the hard edging around the wheels actually has scratched my floors
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Boyter

customer_reviews.title: What’s behind the glowing reviews???
customer_reviews.text: This is my second vacuum. Yes it is adequate for the job BUT, be aware of what you are getting, what people aren’t telling you in the glowing reviews. This vacuum has a major design flaw in the wheels. After a period of time, they just stop working and there isn’t anything you can do to fix this issue. The vacuum is is a piece of living room art at this point. 2 vacuums. Think it’s time to go to dyson 😔
customer_reviews.author: jenjiwater

customer_reviews.title: Works great-few design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Very satisfying to see the wife's hair leave everywhere. The corner feature is useful at times and odd others. The cord mounts on the back to wrap the cords suck. One of mine broke in the 1st two days. Other than that this is a game changer
customer_reviews.author: Brett S.

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it. Works great with pet food
customer_reviews.text: So... I purchased this floor vac in April 2014. It is now May 2018 and I still use this vac all the time. I absolutely love it. Works great with pet food, kibbles, litter and everything in between. Gotta keep everything clean (as with anything) for best results. I've purchased an additional pop-in filter for no interruption of usability. It takes less than three minutes to get used to the benefits... the v-shape sucks stuff up without touching a straight edge. Love, love, love... remember, I've now had it for FOUR YEARS and use it on a regular (more than once a week) basis.
customer_reviews.author: ODUMLAND

customer_reviews.title: This thing works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We have only tile for flooring through the entire house along with two cats and a large dog that sheds all the time. This thing is FANTASTIC at getting up the hair. The design is great for corners and the profile is low enough to get under most furniture. The only downside to this vac is the cord isn't nearly long enough. If they made this (and it may already exist - I haven't checked) cordless it would be better than perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Great Hardwood Floor Pet Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine yesterday and used it for the first time and Im so happy I bought this thing! I have two pitbulls & an entire house of Harwood flooring and this vacuum got everything! From dog hair, to my hair and all the dirt/sand and crumbs that were on the floor. Some reviews state you have to remove the filter but I did NOT and it works great ~ I highly recommend this product and seller, shipped fast and arrived just when i needed it the most! :)
customer_reviews.author: Queenhaus 💀🍒⚓️

customer_reviews.title: lack of range
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight and picks up dirt well enough. Not great, but for the price it sure tries to pick everything up. My only real complaint is how short the cord is. I live in a really small home and have to use 3 different outlets to get all of the floor. Don't have that issue with our steam mop or when we had carpet and used a regular vacuum(which are both Bissell as well) so it's certainly a design flaw with this one.
customer_reviews.author: walter stroing

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: The best use for this, for me, is keeping up on pet hair and dust bunnies. With a shedding dog and two cats it's difficult to deal with the pet hair with just a broom. With a broom the pet hair can get away from you. Not with this! I use it all the time and generally like it. I took one star off because it's noisy and kind of clunky to maneuver. I recommend this but encourage you not to throw your broom out. You will need it for getting underneath furniture, cabinets and in some tight spots. But in general I think it does a better and more thorough job cleaning than my broom alone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I got this vacuum because I have a german shepherd that sheds really bad and I have hardwood floors. There's always hair and dirt particles everywhere. This vacuums amazing with its squeegees underneath. It picks up every particle possible and all of the hair. My floors have never felt so clean. The only thing I don't like is dragging around the cord but it's worth ignoring to get my floors so clean.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great! Until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me 3.5 months before it broke (see photo) and only with weekly use at that, not even daily. I expected more from a good company. Before it broke, it was amazing and I talked it up to many friends. It has a very specific function, and as long as you’re okay with emptying it after every use and maneuvering it differently than a vacuum, it’s wonderful and absolutely a must if you have hairy dogs and hard floors. Just be prepared to zip tie it together after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Damko

customer_reviews.title: Small surface area but great suction
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little vacuum / sweeper. It does a pretty good job at sucking up any dry debris that's on the hardwood or tile floor. It covers a very narrow surface area, however, which makes cleanup take a little bit longer if you are using it to do your entire floor. It's got good suction and isn't very loud. The cord reaches a decent distance but depending on how large of an area you are trying to clean you may need to use an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Fugzine

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing. Light weight and does great with dog hair. The clumps or hair are more difficult to pick up but the loose hair everywhere is totally tamed. It also does an amazing job with dry pet food that gets spilled sometimes! Just saying less than 8lbs and super amazing. I bought it begining of october and it has held up time and again on our lamanent floor. Doesnt work to well for old untreated wood floors though. Pushes bigger items out of the way, like a random sock that got dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Raina Jipson

customer_reviews.title: Works good on hardwoord floors/rubber flooring.
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood and tile in my home. For the last several years i've just been sweeping and it was taking me 30mins+ to sweep all the rooms and hallways. With this vacuum I was able to clean the whole house in about 20mins and it did a much better job than just regular sweeping. It felt different (in a good way) to walk on the floors after using this vacuum. I've only used it once so far but I hope it keeps the suction and power up . Good product. Ty.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good Vac, Not Crazy About the Head
customer_reviews.text: This hard floor vacuum has great suction and tackles my hair along with the animal hair. The cord is nice and long and the swivel action is nice. What I don't like about the vacuum is the v-shaped head. I thought it would be and really "funnel" everything, but it just makes it harder to get up against the wall in tight spaces. That's the only thing keeping this from five stars.
customer_reviews.author: treeber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.text: We, my mother-in-law and I, love this vacuum!! It picks up all my dog's hair and the pine needles and leaves he tracks in too! This was actually a gift from her (my MIL). Is it a hint?? Any way, love this vacuum and it inspires me to have cleaner floors, so that's a good thing, right?? Thank you Amazon for all your hard work and efficiency!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vacuum. It's perfect formy needs. I have two inside outside basset hounds and we live in sandy Florida. It works great on my tile, laminate and vinyl floors. After a quick vacuum I can walk barefoot comfortably and that is what I was looking for. It may not be as convenient as the, BATTERY-POWERED, but then again it's not nearly as expensive and I just leave it plugged in and close to where I needit. It's small and doesn't really get in the way. I do wish the cord was about 5 ft longer...regardless it's a great little vacuum and easy to empty.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third in 6 years. Only because my children are rotten and knock this thing over right and left all day long. After enough abuse even the best made product will break. And it isn't like the price is outrageous. But seriously this vacuum is amazing. Easy to clean, maintain, perfect for pet owners or just people with messy kids and all hardwood floors. I will just keep on buying it again and again. Hope this review helps!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Happy Mama of 4
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I use it every night after everyone goes to bed and for last minute guest. It makes walking on my hardwood floors without house slippers in the morning wonderful! You have to angle it just right to get into some areas, but once you get it you will not have any problems! The only real complaint I could make is how load it sounds when I first turn it on, yet it’s never woke anyone up so more power to me!! I have actually thought about buying it as gifts for others since price is right and I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: greatest thing on the planet for hardwood floors and dog ...
customer_reviews.text: greatest thing on the planet for hardwood floors and dog hair! We have to large dogs that shed alot and this thing makes quick work of their loose hair! I use to fight with a broom and dustpan trying to "trap" the loose flying hairs. With this bad boy I just suck them all up! No more fluffing up the hair while trying to sweep. You will need to clean it out everytime, but sooooo worth it
customer_reviews.author: mark p.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pet Hair
customer_reviews.text: One of the best for pet hair as long as you are on a hard surface floor and you keep the bin and filters clean. Suction power goes down dramatically if you do not keep the filters clean. It is very lightweight and the V head is great for getting around the legs of your furniture. I have had mine about 2 mos now and still love it like day 1.
customer_reviews.author: bretsgirl196

customer_reviews.title: Great for shedding Aussie
customer_reviews.text: We have an Australian Shepherd mix that sheds fine hair constantly. It destroys most vacuums. This thing picks up the hair off hardwood very well. It has good side auction for baseboards and the unique angled design allows it to wrap around chair legs and wall corners with ease. It also funnels and sucks up dog food easily. The hair doesn't really get trapped in the bin, but gets wrapped up around the plastic cyclonic filter at the top. This is easily removed with a twist and the hair comes right off it. I would definitely recommend this for keeping hard floors free of fur.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Porter

customer_reviews.title: Works great on removing Florida sand and dog hair from my tile floors.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and my 4 big dogs track in sand relentlessly. And trail dog hair everywhere. This vacuum sucks up every single grain, and every single hair. I rate this 4 stars only because it feels cheap. I understand they wanted to make it lightweight, which I love, but it seriously feels cheap, like it might not last very long. Time will tell. But again, this is an excellent vacuum on my tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum - Not so good!
customer_reviews.text: Great until it was not and then not fixable. Worked great for about 6 months then got a pet hair clog in the part of the machine to which there is no access. Very long paperweight now. Not a particularly pretty one either. I'll but at Costco from now on. The Dyson is $280, but so is a vacuum from Amazon for $60 - $80, every 6 months for a couple of years. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Twin Fabulous

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Okay I was worried at first but now I love this thing! The aasembly was a little tough because I really struggled with getting the parts to click together. But once I got it all put together, it was fantastic. If you have hardwood floors and pets that shed, this vacuum is perfect! I will say I have some rugs and it's a little harder to vacuum on those but it's still functional and does the job. I'm just in awe at how well it picks up cat & dog hair and even kitty litter. The price and functionality is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: If you have pets, buy this vacuum!!! :)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vacuum I've ever had. I have 3 dogs and 2 cats in my house. This thing is awsome! If you have hardwood, laminate flooring or ceramic tile, this is for you. I can run over cords without suckling them up. No beater brush. The strange looking vacuum head gets around corners and tight places. The dirt cup holds a lot. The filter must be a beast because the dirt cup is still crystal clear, not dust covered inside. The cord is long. It's not loud. I've tried swifter products. What a joke. Same with the cordless shark I bought. And yes it does pick up cat litter and not spit it back at you.
customer_reviews.author: Wicked65

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Broke after 4th use
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has amazing suction! I would be so happy with it, however, the design is impossible to deal with! I couldn’t maneuver it around and the hard plastic’ fins’ constantly bump into things! Then it broke after the 4th use! If I had the box still I would return it! I have a cheap stick handle Bissell that is a dream. I will go back to that. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LaSirena

customer_reviews.title: Very good for it's tasks
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight, great around furniture legs, does not get clogged while it gets all the cat hair easily. Easy to empty too. However, the exhaust for the motor is in the front, and it should be on the back. Go past the fridge and you will blow off have the little photos stuck on near the bottom. The cord is also shorter than desired. Still, a good bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pianophile

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for pet hair and dirt on hard floors
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use for regular cleaning. Filters are easy to clean with water. Simple machine - bought 3 for all the homes in the family. Works wonderful on berber rugs that have dog hair on them - doesn't clean as deeply as a proper vacuum but keeps the vacuum from getting pet dander.
customer_reviews.author: rook

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I have four young children and a golden retriever and I couldn't live without this little vacuum! I use it multiple times a day, mostly in my kitchen where I have tile flooring. It picks up pretty much anything from dog hair to spaghetti noodles with ease! It is super easy to empty, and the filters are easy to clean. In my experience with daily use multiple times each day, the vacuum lasts about three years before it starts loosing its suction. This is the third one I've purchased and I'm happy to do so because it works so well and makes cleaning up the floor after meals a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: OK lightweight budget vacuum
customer_reviews.text: works alright on linoleum/hardwood floors and keeps our place (1000sqft.) clean of the hair 2 cats kindly deposit all over. make sure to remove the foam "extra" or "fine" filter around the actual filter to improve suction. has difficulty on low-profile rugs and certainly cannot help clean up on anything more plush. no beater bar (brush), simply suction-focused. the cord is inconveniently short. good for a lightweight budget vacuum, but might not be enough for some.
customer_reviews.author: hankfrennig

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard floors.  Shape can reach into any corner or crevice with maneuvering.  Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. The shape seems awkward - but it it the most ingenious because you can maneuver this vacuum into any corner or crevice and shape. It’s lightweight. Wish the cord was slightly longer but still a great machine. Easy to use. Not good for carpeting. It has no brush in it - it purely just rolls over items and sucks them up.
customer_reviews.author: lv

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had dark hardwood floors installed. With 4 dogs it became apparent that there was a lot of dog hair and just general dust and debris I had not been seeing. I actually bought this little vacuum after seeing a Bissell commercial that they support shelter dogs. Wow! I plugged it in and could not believe the hair, lint and even sawdust from our remodel it picked up in the master. It is so lightweight and easy that I run it daily when I make up the bed and every single day it picks up a huge wad of hair and debris. I have a big Dyson but this little thing is perfect for hard floors.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ice

customer_reviews.title: Dog hair no longer so annoying ☺️
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have five dogs who shed a LOT. But this little sweeper does a fantastic job of picking up the dog hair. I usually have to empty it after every room because it does fill up quick, but that’s not a big deal to me-takes about 5seconds. It also has enough suction to pick up the dirt. I recommend this to anyone who has a dog (or several) and/or a cat.
customer_reviews.author: Connie L.

customer_reviews.title: DOES pick up my dog's food and does a nice job. The Bissell vacuum is a little weird ...
customer_reviews.text: The beater bar style vacuums shouldn't be used on hardwood or laminate flooring and when the beater bar was turned off on my other Dyson vacuum, it couldn't pick up dog food or other debris from the floor. This Bissell vacuum, however, DOES pick up my dog's food and does a nice job. The Bissell vacuum is a little weird to use at first, but think of it like pac-man, where the stuff on the floor is the ghosts that you're trying to eat. For only $50, this Bissell destroys the beater bar vacuums (with the beater bar turned off).
customer_reviews.author: Josh the Tech Guru

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about this vacuum. Go ahead and get the one that has the removable handle though.. this little thing is so awesome and much more than I expected. I can pull it out and vacuum my entire house in about 10 minutes (hardwood) and follow up with my shark steamer and be thrilled. I plan to gift one to my grandma who just got rid of her carpet for hardwood and has pets. It’s light weight and does a heavy duty cleaning job!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton S.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacume, great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This little vacume really works! I have a 75 lbs. Golden retriever/Staffordshire pit mix who is constantly shedding. We are having a new baby, and I was so worried about the amount of hair we were sweeping off our hardwoods! (Seriously piles of hair everytime we swept and there seemed no end.) After reading reviews, and not wanting to spend $150+. I settled on this one,and I am so happy with my decision. It works great on our carpet, and our hardwood flooring (majority of our home). I was even able to use it on my dogs bed that always had a thick layer of hair even after washing. Definitely a must have for our home.
customer_reviews.author: Val D

customer_reviews.title: WORKS ON HARDWOOD FLOORS
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 dogs all inside and 4 cats with solid hardwood floors throughout our home. I made my family take off their shoes just to feel how clean the floors felt after using it. I wish the cord was about 20 feet longer because it cleans so fast in the area it reaches that I am unplugging it and moving in just a few min. I have a 5,600 square ft home with tile and hardwood thoughout
customer_reviews.author: kat barkley

customer_reviews.title: Buy this vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: We have two thousand square foot of tile floors. This vacuum is amazing! It's very light weight and easy to maneuver, even my kids like to help. The price is right too. I am able to vacuum almost the whole upstairs with one outlet. My husband finally put an extension cord on the vacuum and I can do every room upstairs now. We used to buy the swiffer vacuum. We went through about six of those in six years and finally decided that cordless wasn't worth the extra cost. We've had this vacuum for about 2 years now and have never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: If not for points would not have kept
customer_reviews.text: It is okay but if I had paid money for it instead of using my points I would be returning it. Second time out it would not pick up cat litter or an onion skin on the floor. And yes I had cleaned and emptied everything after the first use ( of which I was highly impressed by the amount of minute debris it picked up) Not so impressed the second time around. Removed the black rubber sleeve and we were back to HURRAH but how it this going to affect the operation of the machine.. I would recommend it for quick pick ups and pet hair
customer_reviews.author: JudyD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I just wanted something light to do a quick vacuum to get the cat hair off my hardwood floors so I didn’t have to lug my dyson vacuum out multiple times a day. This picked up the cat hair better than my $400 dyson. It’s worked on my area rug too. Works way better on hardwood because it doesn’t have a roller like a regulator vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes vacuuming much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this last night, so can’t really comment on durability, etc. but after using it this morning for the first time I can say I love it! Makes it so easier and quicker to vacuum up the dog hair from my constantly shedding black lab. I wish the cord was longer, but that is no biggie as far as I am concerned. Glides over the hardwood and vinyl laminate like a breeze and has good suction. So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cleaning tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this a few years now and really love it. It picks up dirt and hair without any issues. It easily gets into corners and maneuvers easily around obstacles. It's easy to empty the contents you've vacummed up and I'm always shocked at how much it does pick up! I would definitely recommend this to anyone with wood or tile floors!
customer_reviews.author: KmaeL50

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could love this more...but I cannot
customer_reviews.text: I am a Bissell product fan but I cannot say I love this product. It is difficult to maneuver to get close to baseboards, etc. the swivel and V shape of the floor sweep is difficult to control and I have to go over areas many times to get it to pick up dirt....I will say that when I am able to get close to "hair balls" it works well. the Vshape is what is difficult not the ability to pick up dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Warda

customer_reviews.title: Buy it You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: THIS VACUUM HAS SAVED MY SANITY!!!!!! We have two large dogs and a longhaired cat in our home, and sweeping multiple times a day and fur fluttering around after sweeping....this has stopped it all, we run this vacuum over our floors in half the time it takes to sweep. My 10 year old uses it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Best hard wood floor vacuum at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to purchase this vacuum. It picks up dust, crumbs and pet hair on my hard wood and terrazzo floors. I am amazed at all of the pet chair and crumbs inside the canister when I'm done. If you are looking for a powerful vacuum at a decent price, this vacuum is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum over a month ago after reading the reviews. I have cats and a dog. The pet hair and kitty litter has always been an issue. This nifty vacuum does what my more expensive and heavy vacuums do. It gets into corners very easily and picks up everything. The only problem I have is the length of the cord. I wish it was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Corvette1

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical on buying this vacuum but I am so glad I did. It works wonders on my hardwood floors and I think it does help with my allergies when it comes to my cat. The only thing is, it is solely meant for hardwood floors. So if you are trying to buy this as a combo for hardwood floors and carpet, look for something else. Otherwise, it's amazing. Very lightweight and the swivel on this thing makes it very easy to manuever. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya F

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR A STANDARD HARDWOOD FLOOR VACUUM
customer_reviews.text: I loved the sucking power of this vacuum, didn't think it would be able to suck up bottle caps or small hard objects but it did. I was kinda hoping that you could use the vacuum by unattaching the main component from the vacuum head but its meant to be used just how it is seen. The reason for that is because i'm trying to vacuum my air conditioner vents because i recently moved in and wanted to vacuum it out but i can't with this one. other than that works great! just can't vacuum up large objects like objects larger than a bottle cap.
customer_reviews.author: daisy

customer_reviews.title: Buying it again!
customer_reviews.text: Had this same vacuum in an all hardwood house and it worked GREAT for 2 years, then we moved to an apartment with carpet and gave away the vacuum. Making this post because we’ve moved back into a home with lots of hardfloors and I’m about to buy this sucker again! We loved it! 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caffeinated momma

customer_reviews.title: An okay product but the shape is restrictive.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product EXCEPT for the fact that it is shaped like letter V and won't adjust straight. When I am trying to vaccum the corners of my kitchen that are right angles it won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: UserSs

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pet Owners, but Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate relationship with this product. On one hand, it's cheap and flimsy. Several parts of my first vacuum broke away during it's 4-year run, including the handle that connects to the lower unit (I got two extra years out of it by reattaching it with duct tape). Eventually, the screws that keep the lower unit connected began to come undone, and the motor began to blow out so much air that it was impossible to continue using this product. However, when it's working properly, this product sucks up all the hair on our hardwood floors from my constantly shedding lab. I just wish Bissell would make a version with longer lasting materials.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Page

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, and then some!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum was just what I was looking for! We have three cats, a dog and a baby, so our wood floors get nasty fast. This little machine is amazing! It gets in the corners and sucks up hair, dust and crumbs in one pass. We wish the cord was a little longer, but otherwise I highly recommend this vacuum!!
customer_reviews.author: RleeO

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum it worked great for my hardwood floors but now I've had it for over a year and the pet hair got accumulated so the suction got lower. So I thought no problem let me clean out any blocked pet hair. Except there is no access to fully clean it. I can't open the tubing so I can't take out the pet hair that's clogging it. And now it doesn't work!! They need to fix the design flaw. Now I need to buy a new Vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anchal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good! Great a picking up pet hair on ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good! Great a picking up pet hair on my tile/hardwood floor. Not great at sucking up cat litter,Or heavy small objects (I had these miniscule rubber nubs from a floor mat that always broke off). I sometimes have to go over a few times slowly to get that rogue cheerio that my baby threw. I've had it for about 6 months or so and use it almost everyother day. I do empty out the bin and clean both filter areas before every use. It's great for most days when I don't need to superclean, which then I resort to my shop vac.
customer_reviews.author: 3mom

customer_reviews.title: Wow... so much easier and better
customer_reviews.text: So I have tile floors throughout most of my home and 3 dogs that shed... I've used a broom and dust-pan for years but always ended up with hairs that got missed probably disturbed and floating in the air. This sweeper has solved that problem the exhaust is well located and the suction is great. It's kinda funky looking with the pincer "V" shape but it works great around corners and furniture legs.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this cleaner. I have all vinyl flooring and have little dogs. This is so super great to go over the floors and it is amazing how much hair, etc. goes into the bagless container. It is so neat to see the hair just get swallowed up into it along with anything that is in its way. I have a long house so I ordered another, thus, having one at each end. Wish I had come across this sooner. It is fun to use, easy to assemble, a sturdy but light weight. I am also so glad Bissell supports animal rescue as I volunteer with an Illinois rescue group. Thank you, Bissell and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Ochsenschlager

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lightweight vacuum for a month on my lanai floor which has exterior tile. It has very good suction, excellent maneuverability and is easy to carry. It's very easy to remove the dirt cup, empty and replace. It even has a "hook" on the handle to pop in the cord so you don't have to hold the cord while vacuuming. For a small, inexpensive vacuum, it has everything.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a broom all of my life for my hardwood floors but when I got a dog I basically just swept the hair away so I decided to get a vacuum instead. I didn't want to spend too much so I bought this vacuum and it works really well. It's really lightweight and I really like the design. My dog sheds a lot so the compartment gets filled up pretty fast with dog hair but that's a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa ackley

customer_reviews.title: you are not going to believe it @ this $$
customer_reviews.text: unbelievable vacuum for the price! I would have given it 5 stars if the cord wasn't so darn short. but that would be my only complaint. works amazingly great on my wood floors & ceramic tile floors! we live in the desert and it seems like the floors are always dirty, love this quick easy vacuum to clean them right up.
customer_reviews.author: lisa keating

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this exact vacuum 3 tines already
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum so much that i purchased a total of 3 of em. This vacuum is light weight but does an excellent job!!! Its even easy for the kids to use. We use ours strictly on hardwood and tile flooring. Having twin boys means having constant messes to cleanup. With this product cleanup is fast n simple!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cisco n Z

customer_reviews.title: Just remember it takes a little getting used to handling or God in the vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great around corners picking up Adam. It has great suction it has a lot of air blow back on it so if I'm vacuuming my bedroom where my Chinchilla's are it can sometimes catch the hair and just cause it to float up in the air versus sucking it up so that's it's only downside but chinchilla hair is light as air and it does take some getting used to because you don't truly handle it in the standard way you would have regular vacuum cleaner but it does a superb cleaning job so just work with it and learn to handle it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ever for hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hardwood floor vacuum I have ever found. I have 2 cats and shedding goes on 12 months of the year. The suction is amazing. My other vacuum, big, heavy, expensive chases the cat hair around. The PowerEdge draws it in. The "cup" is quite large, easy to empty and easy to put back in. It is a machine but not that noisy. Easy to handle, I'm thinking of buying a back up before they change the model.
customer_reviews.author: Gilda Barnes

product_meta.title: Bissell PowerEdge Pet Hardwood Floor Bagless Cleaner, 81L2A Stick Vacuum, Gray
product_meta.description: Size:DESIGN 1Poweredge pet hard floor vacuum helps you capture both large and small debris with powerful suction and its unique V shaped design. The shape of the base also allows for easy cleaning along furniture legs, along baseboards, and in tight places. Because the Squeegees are made of hair attracting rubber material, they help collect more pet hair than suction alone. Take on all your quick pick ups around the house with the lightweight design and swivel steering of this powerful hard floor vacuum. Power Source Corded. NOTE: Please ensure filters are clean and there are no clogs in the machine preventing the normal out of suction. This item is meant for hard surfaces and not rugs. It is a corded stick vacuum without a rotating brush and not a full size vacuum.
feature_bullets: Every BISSELL purchase helps save pets. BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets.
The V-shape directs larger debris into the center suction path, while the ends of the V capture small, fine debris
Easily cleans aroundfurniture legs and on low pile are legs; Hose Length: No Hose
Easy-to-empty dirtcup makes project cleanup a breeze. Power Rating: 6amps
Cleaning Path Width: 11. 35 inches (V-Shape), Power Cord Length: 20 feet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars8,730 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
